snippet: Providence Community Corrections jailed people who were too poor to pay court fines for traffic violations and misdemeanors, a lawsuit says.
abstract: Federal suit filed by seven probationers against private Tennessee-based probation company Providence Community Corrections accuses company of violating racketeering laws; says company jails poor people simply because they cannot pay court fines for misdemeanor offenses.
lead_paragraph: Providence Community Corrections jailed people who were too poor to pay court fines for traffic violations and misdemeanors, a lawsuit says.

headline.print_headline: Company Extorts Poor on Probation, Lawsuit Says
headline.main: Private Probation Company Accused of Abuses in Tennessee
